revised_title: Observations on Naphthaline: A Peculiar Substance Produced during Coal Tar Decomposition
tldr: The author, J. Kidd, examines naphthaline, a substance resembling a concrete essential oil, produced during the decomposition of coal tar when exposed to a red heat. He describes its properties, such as its aromatic odor and taste, solubility in ether and alcohol, and its tendency to crystallize into rhombic plates.
